DOC.detailed_description: SWIFT prospective , observational , longitudinal cohort study 1,035 woman diagnose GDM pregnancy deliver singleton , live bear infant least 35 week gestation Kaiser Permanente Northern California hospital 2008 2011 , enrol study within 6-9 week postpartum . The SWIFT cohort racially ethnically diverse 35 % Asian , 9 % Black , 31 % Hispanic , 23 % White , 2 % race group . Study enrollment begin mid 2008 complete December 2011 , although annual follow exam continue December 2013 . Women enrol study meet eligibility criterion , provide write , inform consent study procedure prior assessment in-person exam 6-9 week postpartum ( study baseline ) . Participants screen type 2 diabetes enrollment thereafter annual exam subsequent two year use 2-hour 75 gram Oral Glucose Tolerance Test ( OGTT ) . The primary outcome progression glucose intolerance , define incident diabetes ADA criterion within 2 year post-delivery base 2-hour 75 gram OGTT result one year two year postpartum . The primary exposure lactation intensity duration assess in-patient hospital delivery record , annual postpartum in-person exam , telephone call 1 month postpartum , via self-administered monthly mail survey ( 3 11 month postpartum ) . Data collection GDM diagnosis start late gestation throughout two-year postpartum period , accomplish via electronic medical record perinatal course ( e.g. , GDM severity treatment , gestational weight gain ) maternal newborn outcome , telephone contact , mail infant feeding diary survey , self- interviewer-administered questionaires in-person exam . Maternal characteristic assess study include breastfeed intensity duration , infant feeding practice , sociodemographics , medical reproductive history , medication use , recurrence GDM , lifestyle behavior , depression , sleep habit . SWIFT also collect data prospectively via monthly mailing annual in-person exam . In addition , train research assistant measure anthropometry body composition via bioelectrical impedance accord standardized protocol , process stored biospecimens , collect data via self- interviewer-administered questionnaire in-person exam .
